New Records: India recorded their biggest win in terms of runs in T20Is, beating their previous highest margin of 143 runs over Ireland in 2018.
Shubman Gill scored his maiden T20I century and became the 5th Indian to score centuries across formats.
Key Match Events: New Zealand had a disastrous start to their massive run chase, losing four wickets in the first three overs itself.
Hardik Pandya gave India an early breakthrough by removing opener Finn Allen (3) in the first over.
Arshdeep Singh bowled a double-wicket over, dismissing Devon Conway (1) and Mark Chapman (0).
Hardik then came back to remove Glenn Phillips (2) to reduce the Kiwis to 7 for 4 in 2.4 overs.
India eventually bundled out the visitors for just 66 in 12.1 overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The hosts clinched the three-match series 2-1.
It was also the biggest margin of victory in a T20I match between two full member teams.
